metadata.title: International Obligations Affecting U.S. Cultural Resources
metadata.focus: Data specifically covering or affecting cultural resources in the United States

categories: Environmental Protection (affects cultural landscapes, sacred sites)

protected_areas.description: Terrestrial and marine protected areas - includes National Parks, Monuments, and sites with cultural significance
protected_areas.relevance: CRITICAL - Protected areas include thousands of Indigenous sacred sites, archaeological resources, and cultural landscapes

data.notes: Peak protection levels under Obama-era designations

protected_areas.threat_assessment: CRITICAL - 8% reduction in protected terrestrial/marine areas since 2020 threatens cultural landscapes including Bears Ears, Grand Staircase-Escalante, and marine monuments with Indigenous cultural significance

government_expenditure.description: Government expense as percentage of GDP - affects NEA, NEH, IMLS, Smithsonian funding
government_expenditure.relevance: MODERATE - Cultural agency funding depends on overall government spending levels
government_expenditure.threat_assessment: MODERATE - Return to pre-pandemic spending levels has constrained cultural agency budgets despite increased mandate pressures

education_expenditure.description: Government expenditure on education - affects cultural education, tribal colleges, heritage programs
education_expenditure.relevance: MODERATE - Education funding supports cultural transmission, tribal education, museum education
education_expenditure.threat_assessment: WATCH - Stable education spending but cultural education programs face competition from STEM priorities

research_development.description: R&D expenditure - affects cultural preservation research, digital humanities, archaeology
research_development.relevance: WATCH - R&D supports cultural preservation technology and heritage science
research_development.threat_assessment: PROTECTIVE - Increasing R&D supports heritage preservation technology development

treaties_affecting_cultural_resources.description: US withdrew from UNESCO (2017, rejoined 2023), affecting World Heritage site protections
cultural_communities: All communities with heritage at designated sites

treaties_affecting_cultural_resources.treaty: Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species (CITES)
treaties_affecting_cultural_resources.description: Affects trade in cultural items using protected materials (ivory, feathers, tortoiseshell)

treaties_affecting_cultural_resources.treaty: UN Declaration on Rights of Indigenous Peoples (UNDRIP)
treaties_affecting_cultural_resources.description: Framework for Indigenous cultural rights, FPIC for sacred sites
Affects traditional knowledge and genetic resources from Indigenous communities
Climate change threatens cultural landscapes, archaeological sites, coastal heritage
affected_communities: All - particularly Indigenous, Pacific Islander, Caribbean communities

wto_disputes_cultural_relevance.impact: Required changes to US copyright exemptions for music in restaurants/stores
Affects Cuban-origin trademark rights and cultural heritage brands

key_concerns: Bears Ears and Grand Staircase reductions
37% reduction in marine protected areas (2020: 37.4% to 2024: 19%)

economic_context.cultural_funding_pressure: Despite GDP growth of 36% (2020-2024), cultural agency budgets have not proportionally increased

indicators_used: ER.MRN.PTMR.ZS - Marine protected areas (% of waters)
